title: Who wins CLG and TSM game on Sunday (2/15) and why?
body: Personally i think TSM wins because CLG's strongest lane is obviously their bot lane, but honestly, TSM's Lustboy and WildTurtle know how to handle losing lane and or dealing with a lane swap incredibly well. So CLG won't be able to rely on bot-lane for the carry but the "Great Danes" also seem unstoppable. So they'll have to look for ZionSpartan, maybe a classic Jax carry? But I still think TSM takes the W, just my opinion. Please share whether you agree or disagree! And GL HF all in ranked.

replies.body: I think the real question is who do you think can rock the pink hair better- Regi or Hotshot? :D;;
:O did they make a bet to dye their hair?!
That is indeed the real question xD

Tsm is bad and they will get stomped. Wild turtle i s the most overrated player ever and once again double lift will show us how real adcs do it. Also berg is overrated and will get crushed by link. Dyrus will do nothing and santorin is by far the worst jungler in the na lcs.

lol
not sure if clg fanboy or tsm hater
The solo lanes about balance out bjerg and zion are prlly the best respectively but dyrus and link are both in the up half and capable of holding their own. Aphromoo and lustboy are about even overall but with very different strengths.  Double lift is a bit better than wild turtle but unless that makes an impact early on in the 2 v2 not enough to matter. I really don't have enough game knowledge to judge the junglers since their showcases of skill aren't always so obvious. I doubt one player will be able to take over this game so it will come down to shot calling an area where both have looked pretty solid but its been since TSM beat C9 that TSM has looked particularly special with shot calling over all I think the game is about 60/40 in favor of clg.

I have the same opinion... But I can simplify this even further. The winner will be decided by whichever team get LeBlanc.. just a gut feeling..

I am also hoping for a Jayce vs Tryndamere (or a Maokai vs Nasus) remake
I think that's a fair judgement. Honestly, it may come down to who gets first blood in the mid-lane. To be real, if either Bjerg or Link get first blood, they'll just explode after that.

I've watched all the games so far and I have no idea who is going to win.  All I know is that it's really exciting to see a game like this go down.  I think the only advantage CLG has over TSM is that Aphromoo is way better at team fights and skillshots than Lustboy.

If both Bjergsen and Link play perfect mechanical games like they have so far I have no idea who wins midlane.  I'm hoping this game is where both mid laners have to step up their game and one of them will make an impossible play to get the advantage on the other.

I think Turtle and Double lift are equally talented.  I think Zion has had easier laning phases in his games as Dyrus has been camped 1v3 in most of his games.

Tough question! CLG have 3 awesome players in Doublelift, Aphromoo and Zion while TSM only have Bjerg. I think TSM synergy must be a bit better since they have been playing together for a while but I'll bet on CLG .

im bias because I am a CLG fan.... and dislike tsm (because berg is a total prick). but trying to give an honest assessment, I would usually say it breaks down


Zion> Dyrus
xmithlustboy



that's just my generally thoughts on it, but in addition to this... I think Link has been playing "out of his mind impressive" lately... like... holy jeebus he's been crushing ppl, so much that it makes me reconsider my opinion on his skill as a player.

It's gonna be good, I hope it's bloody close match. I'm gonna be rooting for CLG, and I do think they will win. To be fair, TSM has been looking great recently too. If we're talking head to head matchups, I think dlift and aphro are a stronger pair than turtle and lustboy. Bjerg's stronger than Link, but as of late, Link has been looking pretty good himself. I still don't think he'll beat Bjerg unless he gets an early lead. Idk about jung cuz I haven't been paying enough attention to either. Top lane, is about as close as mid. I feel Zion is the stronger player, but Dyrus is about equally as good (eventhough it doesn't show in his stats because he is always camped). Top's probably gonna depend on who wins lane, and which champions are picked (since Zion seems more pick reliant than Dyrus).

CLG's pretty awesome, but I have a hard time visualizing an ADC laning well against the sure pick they're going to see. If Kassadin, Ahri, or Xerath make it to champ select, TSM's going to walk all over them. The bans are going to go far. Either CLG bans all the mid picks and lets TSM get ridiculous team synergy for the late game, or they lose everything but the late game.

But that's just a hypothesis.
Im gonna have to go with clg, They stomped Gravity pretty hard, and I thought they were the best team in na
